title: Atari announces first 64-bit game
body: <p>Excluding the <a href="http://www.google.com/search?q=nintendo+64" title="...oh yeah...">Nintendo 64</a>, the <a href="http://www.google.com/search?q=atari+jaguar" title="the what? I thought Jaguar was a Mac thing?">Atari Jaguar</a> and all their games, <a href="http://www.tomshardware.com/hardnews/20040921_011055.html" title="Tom's">Atari</a> is <a href="http://www.pcpro.co.uk/news/news_story.php?id=63522" title="PCPro">releasing</a> the "first" <a href="http://www.amd.com/us-en/Processors/ComputingSolutions/0,,30_288_11054_11705,00.html?redir=CPGM10" title="AMD">64-bit</a> <a href="http://www.theinquirer.net/?article=18595" title="Inquirer">game</a> called <a href="http://www.atari.com/shadowops/" title="Shadow Ops: Red Mercury">Shadow Ops</a>.  Aside from the fact that the game is natively 64-bit, it also sports [allegedly] awesome AI, higher detailed textures, and THX 5.1 sound.  I wonder why they didn't go with 7.1?  Ah well, it's good to see Atari on the cutting edge again.</p>
